content:
Hi everyone! Since we just had a call, I propose to push the next call to October 14th. That is the World Standard Day!
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Standards_Day

Please comment below for topics to discuss.

Time: 2020-10-14 09.00-10.00 CET
Skype meeting: https://meet.ehelse.no/espen.stranger.seland/5QFTRLCR
@Espen Stranger Seland i forgot that I'm on vacation this week ;)
Sorry about the date for every one of you having an autumn vacation - we’ll catch up. We do not have a set agenda, so I guess it’s going to be brief.

Thank you for the call. I'll not going to start to write meeting minutes, but here are some topics discussed today to follow up:

  • What will the std. group of Nordic Council of Ministers follow up? Keep promoting terminology services (architecture). Sweden and Norway is starting up slow.
  • Nordic Interoperability Project https://nordicinteroperability.com/ More showcase than implementation, FHIR profiling probably up the road

From Nordic eHealth Standardization group meeting summary 2020-09-17:

  • The Nordic countries recommend that the IPS standard (EN 17269) shall be used as a general information model for structuring or mapping patient summaries for national purposes, and for exchanging patient information across the Nordic countries.
  • The Nordic countries have agreed to work on standardization at national and European level so that the gap between national and cross-border exchange of EHRxF information is as small as possible.
